meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for printing.
meanings.sent1: The printability of the document was excellent, making it easy to reproduce.
meanings.sent2: The printability of the book allowed for clear and crisp copies to be made.
meanings.sent3: The printability of the poster was so good that even the smallest details showed up perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her resume had such high printability that it practically jumped off the page.
meanings.sent5: The printability of the map was so impressive that every street name was easily readable.

meanings.definition: The ability to be printed or reproduced in a clear and legible manner.
meanings.sent1: The printability of the image on the flyer was poor, making it hard to read.
meanings.sent2: The printability of the logo on the banner was top-notch, with every detail sharp and clear.
meanings.sent3: Despite its low printability, the handwritten note still managed to convey the message.
meanings.sent4: The printability of the label was so good that it looked like it was professionally done.
meanings.sent5: The printability of the menu was exceptional, making it easy for customers to read and order.
